data.title: Church news
data.meta_description: Concert \n On Saturday, singer songwriter Tracy Grammer will take the stage at 7 p.m. at the White Church in Center Tuftonboro in a benefit concert for the Tuftonboro Free Library Building Fund. Hoste…
data.text:
Concert

On Saturday, singer songwriter Tracy Grammer will take the stage at 7 p.m. at the White Church in Center Tuftonboro in a benefit concert for the Tuftonboro Free Library Building Fund. Hosted by Tuftonboro Music spokesperson Natalie Hebden, Tracy brings her hauntingly beautiful vocals and instrumentals for a concert you won't want to miss.

Grammer is an American folk singer known for her work as half of the folk duo Dave Carter and Tracy Grammer and for the solo career that she has continued since Carter's death. She released three albums with Dave Carter during his lifetime, at first doing instrumental work and providing backing vocals, and then, by their last album together, singing lead vocals on many of the tracks. Two albums by the duo have been released following Carter's death. She has also released three solo recordings, some of which have included previously unreleased songs by Carter.

Pie sale

BRISTOL — On Saturday, Bristol Baptist Church's Christian Education Board will be having a pie sale at Bristol Shop 'N' Save. The pie sale will be from 8 a.m. until the pies are sold. Cost will be $7 per pie. The money raised will be applied to Camperships for our youth.

For more information, call 744-3885.

Ham and bean supper

BRISTOL — On Saturday, Bristol Baptist Church, located at 30 Summer Street in Bristol, will be having a ham and bean supper from 4:30 until 6:30 p.m. The meal will consist of ham and beans, cole slaw, brown bread, rolls and beverage. Dessert will be brownies. The cost of the meal will be $7 for adults and $3.50.

Sermon

FRANKLIN — On Sunday at 10 a.m. at the Unitarian Universalist Church of Franklin, Stan Robinson will present: "Stolen, but Not Lost: to What Extent are We Controlled by our Possessions?"

For more information contact the church office 934-2141.

'Foster & Adoptive Families for NH'

LACONIA — On Tuesday, April 12 at 6:30 p.m., the ladies of "Ready for Service" located at the United Baptist Church, 23 Stark St., Lakeport, will be holding an Open Program on "Foster & Adoptive Families for NH," presented by Beth Bascom. Everyone is welcomed to attend. Coffee/tea and dessert will be served.

Handbell service

LACONIA — Good Shepherd Lutheran Church of Laconia will host the annual Lenten Handbell Service on Wednesday, April 13 at 7 p.m.

For the past three years the handbell choirs of the First United Methodist Church of Gilford, The Congregational Church of Laconia and The Good Shepherd Lutheran Church of Laconia, have worked together to present a Lenten Handbell Service. The service is hosted by each church on a rotating basis, and it is Good Shepherd's turn to host the service this year. Each handbell choir will play eight to 10 minutes of music, and the director of each choir will lead the massed choirs in one selection each. Handbell selections will include pieces written specifically for handbells, hymns, spirituals and more modern pieces suitable for the Lenten journey.

At the service a free will offering will be collected to benefit the Carey House located at 756 Union Avenue in Laconia. The Carey House is a ministry of The Salvation Army, and it is the only homeless shelter in Belknap County, and one of only 20 in the state. It has a total of 30 beds and can house 14 men and six women and up to three families of six people. In 2010 The Carey House operated at full capacity 85 percent of the year.

Senior group

LACONIA — Just Older Youth (JOY), a Christian senior adult group, will be having its monthly luncheon at the LifeQuest Church on Thursday, April 14 at 11:45 a.m. The group meets on the second Thursday of most months to share food, fun, fellowship, and faith. The meal begins at about noon followed by a program at approximately 1 p.m. The April luncheon will feature country-gospel singer Don Smith. A love-offering will be taken to support his ministry of gospel singing. New attendees are welcome; call 524-6860 for more information about the luncheons.

Flea market

GILFORD — There will be an Indoor Flea Market held at the Gilford Community Church, located at 19 Potter Hill Rd., Gilford, on Saturday, April 16 from 8:30 a.m. until noon. Call 455-8880 for information or to rent a table to sell your items. Cost is $10. Or just come by to shop and enjoy coffee and doughnuts!

Easter services

LACONIA — LifeQuest Church, located at 115 Court Street in Laconia, will be recognizing the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ with a number of special events beginning with a Palm Sunday Worship Gathering on Sunday, April 17 at 10:30 a.m. Palm Sunday marks the entrance of Jesus in a triumphal procession into the city of Jerusalem just days before His crucifixion. Pastor Bob Smith will be speaking on the topic " To What Extent Do You Follow Jesus."

On Thursday, April 21, at 7 p.m. LifeQuest Church will host a service to commemorate The Last Supper, remembering Jesus' observance of the Passover Feast with His disciples. A gathering for children will take place on Saturday morning April 23rd from 10:30 a.m. to noon. The theme for this event will be "Understanding Easter" and will include singing, teaching concerning the Resurrection of Jesus, an Easter movie, and refreshments.

On Easter Sunday morning the LifeQuest Sunday School will meet at 9:30 a.m. and the Easter Worship Service will begin at 10:30 a.m. Pastor Smith's sermon subject will be " The End of Death and The Restoration of Life." All are invited to attend these meetings. LifeQuest Church is a part of The Christian and Missionary Alliance. Call 524-6860 for more information.

Turkey dinner

BRISTOL — The Dynamite Dinner Crew of the Bristol United Church of Christ will hold its fourth dinner on Saturday, April 16 from 6:30 to 7 p.m. in the Fellowship Hall of the church, located on the corner of Church and South Main streets in Bristol.

The dinner menu will include roast turkey and all the trimmings, garden salad, rolls, beverages and homemade pies and ice cream by the ladies of the Women's Fellowship, The cost is $8 for adults and $4 for children under 12.

For more information or to arrange for a take out meal, call the church at 744-8132. The next supper will be roast beef on May 14.

Observing Passion Week

BRISTOL — Bristol Baptist Church, located at 30 Summer Street in Bristol, will be observing the Passion Week with the following four serves: Palm Sunday, April 17 at 10 a.m.; Maundy Thursday, April 21 at 7 p.m.; SONRISE service April 24 TBA and Resurrection Sunday April 24 at 10 a.m.

For more information, call 744-3885 or 744-8348.

Annual Crop Walk

BRISTOL — Newfound Area Churches (NAC) will be sponsoring the Annual Crop Walk along with Church World Services (CWS) on Sunday, May 1. Walkers will be gathering at the Bridgewater-Hebron Elementary School at 2 p.m.

Twenty-five percent of all money collected will be donated to Bristol Community Services. It is possible to sponsor a walker on line. For more information call 744-3885.

Easter services

CAMPTON — Easter provides a great opportunity to truly meditate on God's love for his people. The most effective way to experience a Holy Easter is to follow Jesus from the Last Supper on Maundy Thursday, through the Way of the Cross on Good Friday, to the celebration of the victory of Easter Sunday morning. Join the Campton area churches as we embark upon this sacred journey.

On Good Friday, April 22, you are invited to spend time in personal meditation. The Campton Congregational Church will open at 9 a.m. for those who wish to sit in silent meditation. From Noon to 3 p.m. the Congregational Church will host a three hour traditional service on the Seven Last Words of Christ. Then we will gather at 7 p.m. at Campton Baptist Church to walk with Jesus along the 14 Stations of the Cross, a moving meditation on the passion of Jesus. We walk with him to share his burden and his pain and to reflect on our heavenly father's love demonstrated through Christ's suffering on the Cross.

On April 24, at 5:45 a.m., we begin the day of Christ's Triumph on top of Ellsworth Hill where we will have our Sunrise Service. Breakfast will follow at Campton Baptist Church before we move to our respective churches for Easter Services.

For more information, call our church office at 726-4662.
